altitude.description: Altitude is the height of an object or point in relation to a specific reference point, such as the sea level.

id.description: The unique identifier for the biosample.

latitude.description: Latitude is a geographic coordinate which refers to the angle from a point on the Earth's surface to the  equatorial plane.

longitude.description: Longitude is a geographic position that refers to the angle east or west of a reference meridian between the  two geographical poles to another meridian that passes through an arbitrary point.

sample_biome.description: The biome type of the biosample

species.description: The species of micro organisms collected in the sample.
